授業方法: In the spring semester, there will be weekly seminars on Japan's development followed by a series of study of global issues. In the Fall Semester, we will discuss major issues facing the 21st century. By the end of Fall Semester, all students must  submit 4-5,000 words research paper followed by oral presentations. Seminars will be delivered in  classes and online delivery in the fall semester.

第1回: Introduction to the Course & Defining Research Objectives and Significance

1. Read this syllabus and understand the structure and requirements of this seminar course.
2. Write up a reflection on the research project you completed last year.
第2回:
Research Papers: Reflections and New Tasks
Research: To define research topics and significance.
Global Literacy 1: To discuss the Challenges of the 21st Century

1. Propose three possible research topics and their significance.
2. Explain and comment on what Prof. 1. Harari views as major challenges of this century after watching Documentary in URL 1 below.
第3回:
Group workshop: Topics and Significance
Research: Group Workshop
Global Literacy 2: To discuss the challenges of COVID-19

1. Narrow down to one research topic together with well-defined significance.
2. Discuss the challenges which COVID-19 presents for us, after watching Documentary in URL 2 below
第4回:
Research: What is today? What do we need to advance?
Global Literacy 3: To discuss what are the most important skills in the 21st century.
1.Develop a perspective to understand ourselves and challenges and opportunities after watching URL 3 below
第5回:
Myth and Reality: The Making of Postwar Constitution and Revision Debate
Research: Myth vs Reality
Japan Literacy 1: The Making of the Postwar Japanese Constitution

1. Was the postwar Japanese constitution made and imposed by the Allied Powers?
2. Increase an understanding of image and reality in political debate and advance critical thinking skills.
第6回:
Subjectivity and Objectivity in Analysis/Allied Occupation of Japan
Research: Understand how social sciences can be value-driven
Japan Literacy 2: Understand and explain the Allied Occupation and its impact on postwar Japanese development

1. Was the American Occupation successful? Why/why not?
2. What is the impact of the Occupation on postwar Japanese development?
第7回:
Contending Paradigms of Political Economy
Research: Understand analytical, methodological and normative orientations of major paradigms of political economy
1. Was the high economic growth of the 1960s a "miracle"? If not, explain its causes, employing major paradigms of political economy.
第8回:
Contending Perspectives on Japan's High Economic Growth
Research: Apply contending theories and understand its consequences.
Literacy: Deepen an understanding of the Japanese political economy through the high economic growth of the 1960s.
1. What paradigm of political economy best explains the Japanese system of high economic growth?
